speaker: User
message: Hi, I am attending SMU-SJTU DBA qualification exam now. There is one reference article from professor cannot be found in SMU libruary: PERSON_FIRSTNAME_3 W C. Bringing manufacturing back to the US is easier said than done[J]. Harvard Business Review, 2020.

speaker: User
message: Could you please help to check whether there is access to this article in SMU library? Thanks!

speaker: Help Desk
message: Hello, how may I help you?

speaker: Help Desk
message: sure, please give me a moment

speaker: Help Desk
message: ah okay i found it. Would you like me to send it over to you? I can also give you the step-by-step, because HBR articles requires some extra steps to find

speaker: Help Desk
message:
Here are the steps:
1. Go to the SMU libraries homepage. under the search bar, click on "Journal"
2. Search for "Harvard Business Review Digital Articles", and click on "Available online"
3. You will be prompted to login with your SMU credentials.
4. You should arrive at a homepage with EBSCOhost logo on the left. on the right sidebar, you can browse the publication dates to search for the article (if you know the publication date). Otherwise, you can type in your search query into the search bar at the top.

speaker: Help Desk
message: Hi chen yue are you still there?

speaker: Help Desk
message: Did you get my message earlier? about the steps and the article

speaker: User
message: Yes! It is the right article. Thanks a lot for your help! I will look through the steps how to get HBR articles later.

speaker: Help Desk
message: Is there anything else I can assist?

speaker: User
message: Thank you very much! Have nice day!

speaker: Help Desk
message: I will close the chat shortly. Feel free to start a new one if you need help/have more questions later :)
